title: The Mastery of Love
author: Don Miguel Ruiz
description: Offers wisdom for building healthier relationships and healing emotional wounds.

title: The Courage to Be Disliked
author: Ichiro Kishimi & Fumitake Koga
description: A philosophical dialogue exploring Adlerian psychology and how to find true freedom and happiness.

title: Ikigai: The Japanese Secret to a Long and Happy Life
author: Héctor García & Francesc Miralles
description: Introduces the Japanese concept of 'ikigai'—a reason for living—and how to discover yours.

title: The Monk Who Sold His Ferrari
author: Robin Sharma
description: A fable blending self-help and spirituality about a lawyer’s journey to enlightenment.

title: Essentialism: The Disciplined Pursuit of Less
author: Greg McKeown
description: A practical guide to focusing on what truly matters by eliminating the nonessential.

title: Stolen Focus
author: Johann Hari
description: Examines the causes of declining attention spans and offers ways to reclaim focus.

title: Flow: The Psychology of Optimal Experience
author: Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi
description: Explores the state of 'flow'—being fully immersed in activities—and its role in happiness.

title: The Gifts of Imperfection
author: Brené Brown
description: Encourages embracing vulnerability and authenticity as keys to living fully.

title: Radical Acceptance
author: Tara Brach
description: Blends Buddhist teachings and psychology to help overcome self-judgment and embrace life fully.

title: Self-Compassion
author: Kristin Neff
description: Introduces the science and practice of self-compassion as a healthier alternative to self-criticism.

title: The Goldfinch
author: Donna Tartt
description: A Pulitzer Prize-winning novel about a boy whose life is shaped by a tragic accident and a stolen painting.

title: The Secret History
author: Donna Tartt
description: A modern classic about a group of elite students whose obsession with beauty and knowledge leads to murder.

title: Americanah
author: Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie
description: A sweeping story of love, race, and identity following a Nigerian woman’s journey to America and back.

title: Homegoing
author: Yaa Gyasi
description: A multi-generational epic tracing the legacy of slavery through two half-sisters and their descendants in Ghana and America.

title: Transcendent Kingdom
author: Yaa Gyasi
description: A deeply moving novel about faith, science, addiction, and family through the eyes of a Ghanaian-American neuroscientist.

title: White Teeth
author: Zadie Smith
description: A vibrant, multicultural tale about friendship, family, and identity in modern London.

title: On Beauty
author: Zadie Smith
description: A witty and compassionate story exploring family, race, and academia inspired by E.M. Forster’s Howard’s End.

title: Everything I Never Told You
author: Celeste Ng
description: A gripping family drama about secrets, identity, and the pressures of cultural expectations.

title: Little Fires Everywhere
author: Celeste Ng
description: An electrifying novel exploring motherhood, privilege, and identity in suburban America.

title: A Man Called Ove
author: Fredrik Backman
description: A heartwarming story of a curmudgeon whose life changes when new neighbors move in next door.

title: Anxious People
author: Fredrik Backman
description: A comic yet profound novel about a failed bank robbery that turns into an unexpected hostage situation.

title: Beartown
author: Fredrik Backman
description: A powerful drama about community, loyalty, and the dark truths beneath a small town obsessed with hockey.

title: The Vanishing Half
author: Brit Bennett
description: A compelling novel about twin sisters who live very different lives, one passing as white while the other embraces her Black identity.

title: The Mothers
author: Brit Bennett
description: A poignant story about friendship, community, and the lasting impact of youthful choices.

title: Pachinko
author: Min Jin Lee
description: A generational saga about a Korean family in Japan struggling with identity, discrimination, and resilience.

title: Free Food for Millionaires
author: Min Jin Lee
description: A nuanced tale of class, identity, and ambition following a young Korean-American woman in New York.

title: The Sympathizer
author: Viet Thanh Nguyen
description: A Pulitzer Prize-winning spy thriller exploring identity, politics, and morality during and after the Vietnam War.

title: The Refugees
author: Viet Thanh Nguyen
description: A collection of poignant short stories about the lives of Vietnamese refugees and immigrants.

title: Lincoln in the Bardo
author: George Saunders
description: A Man Booker Prize-winning experimental novel about Abraham Lincoln mourning his son, blending history and the supernatural.

title: The Overstory
author: Richard Powers
description: A Pulitzer Prize-winning novel interweaving the lives of people connected through their deep relationship with trees and the natural world.

title: Chapterhouse: Dune (6)
author: Frank Herbert
description: The Bene Gesserit struggle to maintain control after the fall of the God Emperor, navigating intrigue and threats from the Honored Matres.

title: Heretics of Dune (5)
author: Frank Herbert
description: Centuries after the God Emperor’s reign, a new generation confronts shifting powers, ancient secrets, and the dangerous return of old enemies.

title: God Emperor of Dune (4)
author: Frank Herbert
description: Set thousands of years after Paul Atreides, Leto II rules as a near-immortal tyrant, guiding humanity through a vision of ultimate survival.

title: Children of Dune (3)
author: Frank Herbert
description: The heirs of Paul Atreides face political conspiracies and mystical destinies as the future of the Dune universe hangs in the balance.

title: Dune Messiah (2)
author: Frank Herbert
description: Paul Atreides, now Emperor, faces conspiracies and the heavy burden of prescience as his rule sparks religious and political upheaval.

title: Dune (1)
author: Frank Herbert
description: A science fiction masterpiece about Paul Atreides, who rises amidst politics, prophecy, and war on the desert planet Arrakis, home to the spice melange.

title: The Light We Lost
author: Jill Santopolo
description: A moving love story about fate, choices, and the lifelong impact of first love.

title: Project Hail Mary
author: Andy Weir
description: A thrilling sci-fi adventure about a lone astronaut on a mission to save humanity from extinction.

title: The Midnight Library
author: Matt Haig
description: A heartwarming tale about regret, choices, and infinite possibilities through a magical library.

title: Tomorrow, and Tomorrow, and Tomorrow

title: Lessons in Chemistry
author: Bonnie Garmus

title: Happy Place
author: Emily Henry
description: A heartfelt romance about a couple pretending to still be together during a summer getaway with friends.

title: People We Meet on Vacation
author: Emily Henry
description: A delightful friends-to-lovers romance about two best friends reuniting after years apart.

title: November 9
author: Colleen Hoover
description: A romance about fate and timing, where two people meet on the same day every year.

title: Reminders of Him
author: Colleen Hoover
description: A mother’s emotional journey of redemption and reconnection with her daughter after prison.

title: Ugly Love
author: Colleen Hoover
description: An emotional, steamy romance about love, pain, and healing between two broken souls.

title: Verity
author: Colleen Hoover
description: A psychological thriller where a writer uncovers disturbing secrets while finishing another author’s book series.

title: Archer’s Voice
author: Mia Sheridan
description: A heartfelt romance about a woman healing from loss and a man who has lived in silence.

title: Before We Were Strangers
author: Renée Carlino
description: A second-chance romance about college sweethearts who reconnect years later through a missed connection ad.

title: The Song of Achilles
author: Madeline Miller
description: A lyrical retelling of the Iliad through the love story of Achilles and Patroclus.

title: Circe

title: All the Light We Cannot See
author: Anthony Doerr

title: A Little Life
author: Hanya Yanagihara

title: Eleanor Oliphant Is Completely Fine
author: Gail Honeyman
description: A quirky and uplifting story about loneliness, kindness, and the power of human connection.

title: The Fault in Our Stars
author: John Green
description: A heartbreaking yet inspiring love story between two teenagers with cancer.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
description: A powerful WWII novel narrated by Death, about a young girl who finds solace in books during Nazi Germany.

title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a F*ck
author: Mark Manson

title: Atomic Habits

title: The 48 Laws of Power
author: Robert Greene

title: The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People
author: Stephen R. Covey
description: A classic guide to personal effectiveness, productivity, and leadership through timeless habits.

title: Deep Work
author: Cal Newport
description: An exploration of how focused, distraction-free work can drive extraordinary productivity and success.

title: The Power of Now
author: Eckhart Tolle
description: A spiritual guide teaching the importance of living fully in the present moment to find peace and fulfillment.

title: Thinking, Fast and Slow
author: Daniel Kahneman

title: Outliers

description: An exploration of the hidden factors behind extraordinary success, from culture to opportunity and hard work.

title: The Tipping Point
author: Malcolm Gladwell

title: Grit
author: Angela Duckworth
description: A motivational book showing how perseverance and passion can be more important than talent for success.

title: You Are a Badass
author: Jen Sincero
description: A fun, motivational self-help book filled with humor and practical advice to build confidence and success.

title: Rich Dad Poor Dad
author: Robert Kiyosaki
description: A personal finance classic contrasting two financial mindsets and teaching the basics of building wealth.

title: The Lean Startup
author: Eric Ries
description: A business book introducing lean startup methodology, focusing on innovation, testing, and sustainable growth.

title: Start with Why
author: Simon Sinek

title: Mindset
author: Carol S. Dweck

title: Drive
author: Daniel H. Pink

title: Daring Greatly
author: Brené Brown
description: A book about embracing vulnerability as a strength and living a more courageous and connected life.

title: The Happiness Project
author: Gretchen Rubin
description: An engaging memoir and guide on how to pursue happiness through small, intentional lifestyle changes.

title: Make Your Bed
author: Admiral William H. McRaven

title: The War of Art
author: Steven Pressfield

title: Educated

author: Anne Frank

title: In Cold Blood
author: Truman Capote

title: The Bell Jar
author: Sylvia Plath

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: The gothic tale of Victor Frankenstein, who creates a living being, only to face the tragic consequences of defying nature.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
description: The iconic gothic horror novel introducing Count Dracula and the legend of the vampire.

title: Notes from Underground
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A groundbreaking existentialist novella exploring alienation, free will, and the psychology of self-destruction.

author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A philosophical masterpiece exploring morality, faith, free will, and the conflict between reason and spirituality.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

title: Cat’s Cradle

description: A satirical science fiction novel exploring science, religion, and the end of the world.

title: Slaughterhouse-Five

title: Catch-22

title: The Grapes of Wrath
author: John Steinbeck
description: A moving story about a family’s struggle during the Great Depression as they migrate to California in search of a better life.

title: East of Eden
author: John Steinbeck
description: A sweeping novel about two families in California, exploring good and evil, love, and betrayal.

title: Of Mice and Men
author: John Steinbeck
description: A tragic story of two displaced migrant workers during the Great Depression pursuing their dream of owning land.

title: A Farewell to Arms
author: Ernest Hemingway
description: A tragic romance set during World War I, following the love between an American ambulance driver and a British nurse.

title: The Old Man and the Sea
author: Ernest Hemingway

title: Meditations
author: Marcus Aurelius

title: Thus Spoke Zarathustra
author: Friedrich Nietzsche
description: Nietzsche’s philosophical novel presenting ideas of the Übermensch, eternal recurrence, and the death of God.

title: The Stranger
author: Albert Camus

title: Siddhartha
author: Hermann Hesse
description: A spiritual journey of self-discovery inspired by the life and teachings of the Buddha.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury

title: Still Me
author: Jojo Moyes
description: Louisa Clark embarks on a new adventure in New York, navigating love, friendship, and self-discovery while staying true to herself.

title: After You
author: Jojo Moyes
description: Picking up after the events of Me Before You, Louisa struggles to move forward and rebuild her life, finding hope in unexpected places.

title: Me Before You
author: Jojo Moyes
description: The unforgettable love story of Louisa Clark and Will Traynor, a man left paralyzed after an accident, exploring themes of choice, love, and loss.

title: The Wedding
author: Nicholas Sparks
description: A heartfelt sequel to The Notebook, focusing on Wilson Lewis as he struggles to rekindle his marriage with Jane, with guidance from his father-in-law Noah Calhoun.

title: The Notebook
author: Nicholas Sparks
description: A timeless love story about Noah and Allie, two people from different worlds whose passionate romance faces the challenges of class, war, and time.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A witty and timeless story of love, class, and misunderstandings between Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Brontë
description: A dark and passionate tale of love and revenge between Heathcliff and Catherine Earnshaw.

title: Anna Karenina
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A tragic love story about a woman torn between duty and forbidden passion.

title: Gone with the Wind
author: Margaret Mitchell
description: A sweeping historical romance set during the American Civil War.

title: The Hating Game
author: Sally Thorne
description: A fun enemies-to-lovers office romance full of banter and chemistry.

title: Beach Read
author: Emily Henry
description: A witty and heartfelt romance between two writers who challenge each other to swap genres.

title: Red, White & Royal Blue
author: Casey McQuiston
description: A contemporary queer romance between the First Son of the U.S. and a British prince.

title: Normal People
author: Sally Rooney
description: An intimate and raw romance about two people whose bond keeps pulling them back together.

title: Astrophysics for People in a Hurry

title: The Emperor of All Maladies

title: Chaos: Making a New Science
author: James Gleick
description: An introduction to chaos theory, exploring how complex and unpredictable systems shape our world.

title: Surely You're Joking, Mr. Feynman!

title: The Demon-Haunted World: Science as a Candle in the Dark
author: Carl Sagan

title: The Double Helix
author: James D. Watson

title: The Structure of Scientific Revolutions
author: Thomas S. Kuhn
description: A groundbreaking work in philosophy of science introducing the concept of paradigm shifts in scientific progress.

title: Silent Spring
author: Rachel Carson
description: A revolutionary book exposing the dangers of pesticides, sparking environmental awareness and modern ecology.

title: The Origin of Species
author: Charles Darwin
description: The landmark work that introduced the theory of evolution by natural selection, revolutionizing biology and science.

title: Cosmos
author: Carl Sagan
description: A poetic and inspiring journey through the universe, blending astronomy, history, and philosophy in a way that popularized science worldwide.

title: The Selfish Gene
author: Richard Dawkins
description: A revolutionary view of evolution that emphasizes genes as the driving force of natural selection, reshaping evolutionary biology.

title: A Brief History of Time
author: Stephen Hawking
description: An accessible exploration of cosmology, black holes, time, and the nature of the universe, written for general readers.

title: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King (3)
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: The final volume of The Lord of the Rings, where the forces of good make their last stand against Sauron and Frodo faces the ultimate trial to destroy the One Ring.

title: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers (2)
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: The Fellowship is broken as Frodo and Sam journey to Mordor, while Aragorn, Legolas, and Gimli aid in the defense of Rohan against Saruman’s armies.

title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring (1)
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: The first volume of The Lord of the Rings introduces the journey of Frodo and the Fellowship as they set out to destroy the One Ring and resist the growing shadow of Sauron.

title: A Dance with Dragons (5)
author: George R.R. Martin
description: The fifth volume follows Daenerys struggling to rule in Meereen, Jon Snow’s leadership at the Wall, and Tyrion’s survival in exile as war continues in Westeros.

title: A Feast for Crows (4)
author: George R.R. Martin
description: The aftermath of war reshapes Westeros as new rulers rise, alliances form, and plots deepen, while the Ironborn and Dornish seek vengeance.

title: A Storm of Swords (3)
author: George R.R. Martin
description: The third book delivers shocking betrayals, including the infamous Red Wedding, as battles rage and the Night’s Watch faces threats beyond the Wall.

title: A Clash of Kings (2)
author: George R.R. Martin
description: Civil war engulfs Westeros as rival kings stake claims to the Iron Throne, while Stannis Baratheon turns to shadowy magic to fight his battles.

title: A Game of Thrones (1)
author: George R.R. Martin
description: The first book introduces the Seven Kingdoms, the Starks of Winterfell, the political intrigues of King’s Landing, and the ancient threat in the far North.

title: The Kite Runner
author: Khaled Hosseini
description: A moving story of friendship, betrayal, and redemption set against the backdrop of Afghanistan's turbulent history.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: A gothic tale exploring vanity, morality, and the consequences of eternal youth.

title: The Road
author: Cormac McCarthy
description: A haunting post-apocalyptic journey of a father and son struggling to survive.

title: Life of Pi
author: Yann Martel
description: A philosophical survival story of a boy stranded at sea with a Bengal tiger.

title: Beloved
author: Toni Morrison
description: A powerful novel about the haunting legacy of slavery and a mother’s unbreakable bond.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel García Márquez
description: A masterpiece of magical realism telling the multi-generational story of the Buendía family.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A coming-of-age novel capturing the rebellious voice and struggles of youth.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: An inspiring allegorical tale about following your dreams and finding meaning in life.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A powerful story of justice, childhood, and morality in the racially divided American South.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel exploring surveillance, truth, and totalitarianism.

title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows (7)
author: J.K. Rowling
description: Harry, Ron, and Hermione go on a dangerous mission to destroy Voldemort’s Horcruxes and face the final battle for the wizarding world.

title: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince (6)
author: J.K. Rowling
description: Harry learns more about Voldemort’s past and the dark secrets hidden in Horcruxes while preparing for the ultimate battle.

title: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix (5)
author: J.K. Rowling
description: As Voldemort gains power, Harry and his friends form Dumbledore’s Army to fight against the dark forces threatening Hogwarts and the wizarding world.

title: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (4)
author: J.K. Rowling
description: Harry unexpectedly competes in the dangerous Triwizard Tournament and faces challenges that test his courage and skill.

title: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (3)
author: J.K. Rowling
description: Harry learns about Sirius Black, a dangerous prisoner who has escaped from Azkaban and is believed to be after him.

title: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (2)
author: J.K. Rowling
description: Harry returns to Hogwarts and faces the dark secrets of the Chamber of Secrets, where a deadly monster has been unleashed.

title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone (1)
author: J.K. Rowling
description: The beginning of Harry’s journey into the wizarding world as he discovers he is a wizard and attends Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.
